issue.title: [Documentation][Format] Clarify (lack of) alignment requirements in C data interface
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-8320](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8320). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This document should clarify that memory buffers need not start on aligned (8-byte or otherwise) pointer offsets.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8320?focusedCommentId=17073958) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
An embedded question here is what kinds of issues might occur in our C++ library if fed memory that is not word-aligned. Probably the documentation should _recommend_ using aligned memory but not _require_ it
